item.title: Full page images
item.description: Henri Menke recently answered a question on TeX.SE, which reminded me of a trick that I use in my presentations. In my presentations, sometimes I include just an image that occupies the whole slide. So, the image should have a maximum width equal to \textwidth, a maximum height equal to \textheight, and should maintain the original aspect ratio. How to achieve this?
